349963a2-97b2-4654-b990-ac8f58f1f7a2.description: This commemorates participation in the SUNY Online Summit, and acknowledges the holder’s commitment to their own ongoing professional development and efforts to continuously improve as an online practitioner, and is evidence of their active engagement in the SUNY Online & SUNY Online Teaching community of online practitioners.

They assert that they have reviewed the various perspectives, online pedagogies, and models presented, understand the fundamentals, and can use the information to determine if online teaching is a good fit for them.

Workgroups are assembled from the OSCQR user community for varied targeted projects to continuously improve, update, and develop OSCQR. Recipients volunteered and/or were selected to participate in working teams requiring the time, skills, knowledge, and expertise for projects of some duration.

Successfully contribute to, and actively engage and participate in an OSCQR workgroup project that results in substantive changes/improvements to OSCQR.

43858db6-e904-4866-a610-9b298a2f97e7.description: Earners of this acknowledgement have a basic understanding of the use of social media for professional and academic purposes. Badge earners know how to use Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram and/or YouTube, for example, and have demonstrated the ability to use these tools to promote the Open SUNY Center for Online Teaching (COTE) community, to share their affinity for online and technology-enhanced education, and to connect with others who have similar interests at a basic level.

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in and contribute posts to 2-4 unique social networks. Posts should demonstrate and advance an interest in online education, promote effective online teaching and learning practices, and/or share related tips, tools, and resources. And, may include, for example, posts that promote the visibility of Open SUNY, the Center for Online Teaching Excellence (COTE), or Open SUNY COTE online teaching community events or initiatives (e.g., live-tweeting the annual Open SUNY COTE Summit).

Demonstrate a substantive and ongoing social media presence with regular participation in and contributions to at least 3 unique social networks. Posts should advocate for online learning and
promote effective online teaching and learning practices, and share related tips, tools, and resources. Additionally, posts should promote online education in SUNY, and demonstrate the effective use of hashtags, for example, #cotesummit, #onlinelearning, #opensuny.

Earners understand the features and functionality of the OSCQR rubrics and dashboard, and the scope and intent of the OSCQR process. With a basic understanding of the standards and practice applying them in a workshop setting, they have what is necessary to conduct online course reviews and craft constructive actions plans to improve the quality and accessibility of online courses.

They use Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram and/or YouTube, for example, and have the demonstrated ability to leverage these tools for academic and professional purposes. Earners are able to use social media for professional development purposes to network with experts, share work, and connect to others interested in online education.
731d76cf-86e3-4785-8a2b-22bccbe80b49.name: Open SUNY COTE Social Media Journeyman

Posts should advocate for online education, promote effective online teaching and learning practices, and share related tips, tools, and resources. Additionally, posts should promote online education in SUNY, the Open SUNY Center for Excellence (COTE), or Open SUNY online teaching events or initiatives, and demonstrate the effective use of hashtags, for example, #cotesummit, #onlinelearning, #opensuny.

skills.name: Ability To Build And Develop Professional Relationships

ca32e3d8-a5f4-472d-b004-6afb0477234b.description: This verifies that the earner has successfully participated in this 90-minute webinar, a requirement of the “Using the Medium Effectively” certificate program. Earners have received a demonstration of the Blackboard (Bb) Retention Center and available Course Reports. Each report type is reviewed. Earners have been shown how to use monitor student progress, access, activity, grades, and submissions, and discuss how the Retention Center might be used in their own instruction.
ca32e3d8-a5f4-472d-b004-6afb0477234b.name: Open SUNY COTE: Monitoring Student Success: Running Bb Reports and Using the Blackboard Learn Retention Center

badge_template_activities.title: Register and participate in the "Monitoring Student Success: Running Bb Reports and Using the Blackboard Learn Retention Center" webinar.

Provide the following evidence: 1) a description of what Bb Reports you run, why & when, and 2) a description of how you have set up your Bb Retention Center  and how it is used for retention and monitoring your online students in your online course. (For online instructional designers please provide a description of the recommendations you make to online faculty regarding the use of these 2 Bb course management evaluation utilities.)
Join the Open SUNY Online Networking Community.
Join and participation in the Open SUNY Blackboard User Group.

skills.name: Using Blackboard Monitoring Tools: Effective Practices in Online Success

aa2bf5f3-68a1-4352-b608-2e57addd474a.description: This certifies the earner has satisfactorily completed the “Become an OSCQR Online Course Reviewer” workshop. Earners understand the features and functionality of the OSCQR rubrics and dashboard, and the scope and intent of the OSCQR process. With a basic understanding of the standards and practice applying them in a workshop setting, they have what is necessary to conduct online course reviews and craft constructive actions plans to improve the quality and accessibility of online courses.
aa2bf5f3-68a1-4352-b608-2e57addd474a.name: SUNY Online Teaching: Become an OSCQR Online Course Reviewer

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the SUNY Online Teaching “Become an OSCQR Online Course Reviewer” workshop.

skills.name: Effective Practices in Online Course Design

7485e575-3085-4314-ac7c-d4da3a22c480.description: This verifies that the earner selected successfully completed an internship with the Open SUNY Online Teaching unit. They experienced various aspects of supporting online teaching and learning to gain real-world experience in our award-winning online teaching and learning program. They have developed entry-level skills based on their interests in areas such as online instructional design and technology, online course quality, online faculty support/development, and related media/communications.
7485e575-3085-4314-ac7c-d4da3a22c480.name: Open SUNY Online Teaching Intern

badge_template_activities.title: Apply, be selected, and complete the Open SUNY Online Teaching Internship.

3886c916-720a-426a-8ff8-866aee8260fa.description: This certifies the earner has satisfactorily completed the “Supporting Regular and Substantive Interaction (RSI) with OSCQR” workshop. Earners have received an overview of the US Department of Education federal regulation on RSI, and discussed how to apply the OSCQR RSI-related standards. With the tools and resources, and information presented in the workshop setting, they have what is necessary to support compliance with this regulation at institutional, course, and instructional levels.
3886c916-720a-426a-8ff8-866aee8260fa.name: SUNY Online Teaching: Supporting Regular and Substantive Interaction with OSCQR

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the SUNY Online Teaching “Supporting Regular and Substantive Interaction with OSCQR” workshop, which provides a brief OSCQR overview; a detailed overview of the purpose, scope & definitions of the US Department of Education regulation; the opportunity to apply OSCQR standards that support RSI; and the opportunity to consider developing a plan on how to ensure compliance with the RSI regulation at campus, course, and instructional levels.

c9c466ef-228a-48b8-bcf6-342de9db04c3.description: This verifies that the earner is qualified as an online course reviewer using OSCQR, and has experience completing the full process of an OSCQR online course quality review and refresh. The Open SUNY Course Quality Review Rubric (OSCQR) is a research-based set of standards that target online course instructional design quality and accessibility. The OSCQR tools and resources support online course quality review and continuous improvement processes.
c9c466ef-228a-48b8-bcf6-342de9db04c3.name: Open SUNY Certified OSCQR Reviewer

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the "Open SUNY Center for Online Teaching Excellence: Become an OSCQR Online Course Reviewer" and/or the "Overview of the Open SUNY Course Quality Review (OSCQR) Process and Introduction to OSCQR Rubric" workshops.
Conduct an online course quality review and refresh using the self-assessment, or interactive online OSCQR rubrics, to review the design and accessibility of an online course.
Complete the full OSCQR process to review, refresh, and improve at least one online, or blended course.
Open SUNY OSCQR Self-Assessment & Refresh
With this certification, earners are eligible to apply to join the pool of OSCQR-certified reviewers, and submit their own course for review.

skills.name: Accessibility And Inclusiveness In Course Design
Effective Practices in Online Course Design
Improve Old Online Course According To New Standards

6a05858f-2f4b-45b5-b12a-a618809aca6c.description: This badge verifies the holder as a qualified OSCQR Trainer with depth of experiences in the use of OSCQR to train others to use OSCQR tools, resources, and process to conduct online course self-assessments, reviews, and refreshes. The Open SUNY Course Quality Review Rubric (OSCQR) is a research-based set of standards that target online course instructional design quality and accessibility. The OSCQR tools and resources support online course quality review and continuous improvement processes.
6a05858f-2f4b-45b5-b12a-a618809aca6c.name: Open SUNY Certified OSCQR Trainer

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the "Open SUNY Center for Online Teaching Excellence: Become an OSCQR Online Course Reviewer" and/or the "Overview of the Open SUNY Course Quality Review (OSCQR) Process and Introduction to OSCQR Rubric" workshops.
Conduct five (5) online course quality review using the self-assessment, or interactive online OSCQR rubrics, to review the design and accessibility of the five (5) online courses.
Complete the full OSCQR process to review, refresh, and improve at least five (5) online, or blended courses.

skills.name: Accessibility And Inclusiveness In Course Design
Effective Practices in Online Course Design
Improve Old Online Course According To New Standards

e17724a9-e126-4564-ac23-175a4db9011b.description: This verifies that the holder has successfully completed an introductory overview of the OSCQR review and refresh process, and has completed an online course quality review and refresh with the OSCQR self-assessment rubric. The Open SUNY Course Quality Review Rubric (OSCQR) is a research-based set of standards that target online course instructional design quality and accessibility. The OSCQR tools and resources support online course quality review and continuous improvement processes.
e17724a9-e126-4564-ac23-175a4db9011b.name: Open SUNY OSCQR Self-Assessment & Refresh

badge_template_activities.title: Open SUNY Center for Online Teaching Excellence (COTE): Overview of the Open SUNY Course Quality Review (OSCQR) Process and Introduction to the OSCQR Rubric

Conduct an online course quality self-assessment to review,  identify, and prioritize what needs improvement in the design and accessibility of your online course using the OLC-adopted OSCQR self-assessment rubric.

Complete the full OSCQR process based on your self-assessment to update, revise, refresh, and improve the design and accessibility of your online course. The process can be completed independently, using the http://oscqr.suny.edu companion resources , or with the assistance of your campus online instructional designer, or other campus resources.

skills.name: Accessibility And Inclusiveness In Course Design
Improve Old Online Course According To New Standards

4b34064e-9f63-485b-a7ed-6be1125804b1.description: This certifies that the earner has satisfactorily completed Module 1 of the SUNY Online Teaching N2OL program. Earners have gained the perspective of being an online student by participating in online learning activities; self-assessed their computer skills; reconceptualized course learning objectives for the online teaching and learning environment; developed and submitted their online course description and course information written assignments; and, accessed/acclimated to the Bb environment.
4b34064e-9f63-485b-a7ed-6be1125804b1.name: New to Online (N2OL) Module 1: Being an Online Learner: Reflect

badge_template_activities.title: Satisfactorily complete the required assignments for: N2OL “Module 1: Being an Online Learner: Reflect."

9dc4ad83-26d1-433c-b2b7-43d1c1d791b0.description: This certifies that the earner has satisfactorily completed Module 2 of the SUNY Online Teaching N2OL certificate program. Earners focus on course deign and how they will build trust and online community; drafted course information documents to welcome and orient their online learners; drafted and revised a list of their online course module names; and, drafted and revised the outline of online course learning activities to meet their reconceptualized learner-centered online course objectives.
9dc4ad83-26d1-433c-b2b7-43d1c1d791b0.name: New to Online (N2OL) Module 2: Welcoming and Orienting your Online Students: Connect & Organize

badge_template_activities.title: Satisfactorily complete the required assignments for: N2OL “Module 2 Designing Your Online Course: Welcoming and Orienting your Online Students."

774b77f7-7ebb-4dc5-9888-0ae9702cff35.description: This certifies that the earner has satisfactorily completed Module 3 of the SUNY Online Teaching N2OL certificate program. Earners focus on course development and have drafted the learning activities for each module in their online course; developed/curated online course content, materials, presentations, and assessments to meet course learning objectives and provide context for learning activities; and, refined course structure and content using the online course quality rubric and checklists.
774b77f7-7ebb-4dc5-9888-0ae9702cff35.name: New to Online (N2OL) Module 3: Using Blackboard to Support Your Online Pedagogy - Build & Refine

62d05455-b20d-48dc-9957-c630890a1fa0.description: This certifies that the earner has satisfactorily completed the 4 modules that comprise the COTE Online Instructional Designer certificate program. Including: 1: Helping Faculty with New Online Course Development; 2: Curating & Evaluating Resources for Faculty; 3: Professional Foundations: Collaborating, Researching & Networking; and 4: Course Quality Review (OSCQR). Earners who complete this 16-week online program are prepared with the fundamentals to support online faculty and course design.

7f31ee4f-c6cc-4f20-813c-600f007f63ca.description: This verifies that the earner has successfully participated in this 90-minute webinar, a requirement of the “Using the Medium Effectively” certificate program. Earners received a demo on how to use Bb rubrics to provide students with criteria and achievement levels for all online course assignments and tasks. Earners discussed the benefits of rubrics to provide clear objective performance expectations & how to use Bb to create rubrics & use them for assignments, projects, and discussion forums.
7f31ee4f-c6cc-4f20-813c-600f007f63ca.name: Open SUNY COTE: Blackboard Learn (Bb) Rubrics as a Tool to Monitor & Evaluate Student Interaction & Performance

badge_template_activities.title: Register and participate in the"Rubrics as a Tool to Monitor and Evaluate Student Interaction and Performance" webinar.

Provide the following evidence: 1) a description of the rubrics you use in your online course (how you have set them up and why); and, 2) how they are used by your online students. (For online instructional designers please provide a description of the recommendations you make to online faculty regarding the use of rubrics online, and the design and use of Bb rubric utilities to facilitate online assessment, evaluation, and provide feedback.)

Join and participation in the Open SUNY Blackboard User Group.

3c0893dd-0116-417f-a1c2-3216c395d1b3.description: This verifies that the earner has successfully participated in the two-hour, a requirement of the “Using the Medium Effectively” certificate program. Participants review each Bb question type, examples, question pools in the tests area, and the Reuse Question option on the test canvas. Participants receive demonstrations of how and when to use Question Sets, the Find Question option, Random Blocks, and practice creating questions and developing tests in their own online course.
3c0893dd-0116-417f-a1c2-3216c395d1b3.name: Open SUNY COTE: Blackboard Learn Tests: Going Beyond Multiple Choice

This program provides SUNY Fellows in the advanced roles an opportunity to share their expertise, contribute to the community, and expands the ability of SUNY Online (formerly Open SUNY) to scale professional development activities and engagements.
a5473118-4fcb-458f-b6f0-b237a0590745.name: SUNY Online Professional Development (PD) Associate

badge_template_activities.title: Meet the criteria for this authorization, complete the application, and be selected.

skills.name: Ability To Build And Develop Professional Relationships

117f7766-7583-499d-8d8e-28f577a07305.description: Earners of this acknowledgement have a basic understanding of the use of social media for professional and academic purposes. Badge earners know how to use Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram and/or YouTube, for example, and have demonstrated the ability to use these tools to promote the SUNY Online Teaching community, to share their affinity for online and technology-enhanced education, and to connect with others who have similar interests at a basic level.
117f7766-7583-499d-8d8e-28f577a07305.name: SUNY Online Social Media Apprentice

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in and contribute posts to 2-4 unique social networks. Posts should demonstrate and advance an interest in online education, promote effective online teaching and learning practices, and/or share related tips, tools, and resources. And, may include, for example, posts that promote  the visibility of SUNY Online, or SUNY Online teaching community events or initiatives (e.g., live-tweeting the annual SUNY Online Summit).

skills.name: Ability To Build And Develop Professional Relationships

9040054e-7514-4a14-afd7-d2666143b3bb.description: Earners are acknowledged for their use of social media and contribute to public discourse on online and technology-enhanced education at an intermediate level. They use Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram and/or YouTube, for example, and have the demonstrated ability to leverage these tools for academic and professional purposes. Earners are able to use social media for professional development purposes to network with experts, share work, and connect to others interested in online education.
9040054e-7514-4a14-afd7-d2666143b3bb.name: SUNY Online Social Media Journeyman

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate regular participation in and contributions to at least 3 unique social networks. Posts should advocate for online education, promote effective online teaching and learning practices, and share related tips, tools, and resources. Additionally, posts should promote the visibility of online education in SUNY, SUNY Online, or SUNY Online Teaching community events or initiatives, and demonstrate the effective use of hashtags, for example, #SUNYonlinesummit, #onlinelearning, #sunyonline.

skills.name: Ability To Build And Develop Professional Relationships

3845a8b7-e8dc-4eb4-9fb1-55b472b15065.description: Earners are experts in the use of social media for academic and professional purposes, and are recognized for their expertise and contributions to public discourse on online and technology-enhanced education. Earners actively seek to leverage a variety of social media for professional development and social networking purposes on a daily basis, and have developed trusted ongoing relationships from their online interactions demonstrated by their numbers of followers, retweets, and/or shares.
3845a8b7-e8dc-4eb4-9fb1-55b472b15065.name: SUNY Online Social Media Master

badge_template_activities.title:
Demonstrate a substantive and ongoing social media presence with regular participation in and contributions to at least 3 unique social networks. Posts should advocate for online learning and
promote effective online teaching and learning practices, and share related tips, tools, and resources. Additionally, posts should promote online education in SUNY, and demonstrate the effective use of hashtags, for example, #SUNYonlinesummit, #onlinelearning, #SUNYonline.

skills.name: Ability To Build And Develop Professional Relationships

d4b63f56-79bb-41d9-8c89-a2da2b379cc0.description: This commemorates participation in the SUNY Online Summit, and acknowledges the holder’s commitment to their own ongoing professional development and efforts to continuously improve as an online practitioner, and is evidence of their active engagement in the SUNY Online & SUNY Online Teaching community of online practitioners.

e6278aba-e9b5-479f-b81b-97663ea50ae4.description: Those verified into this role are experienced online faculty and practitioners willing share what they know with peers and colleagues in online instructional design and effective online teaching practices. Earners are recognized for their expertise and willingness to coach & mentor those newer to online teaching & learning. Earners of this badge represent members in our online community of practice whose participation, experience, and expertise come from within the SUNY system.
e6278aba-e9b5-479f-b81b-97663ea50ae4.name: SUNY Online Teaching Fellow: Exemplar Online Coach and Mentor

Be verified and have membership in this role accepted.
Volunteer to coach and mentor others in the SUNY Online Teaching community.
Complete the OSCQR training and certification process.

8c86c073-ff3f-4c93-91d1-a82f29d2727e.description: This acknowledges members in our online community of practice whose participation, experience, and expertise come from within the SUNY system. Earners acknowledged as “Experienced Online Practitioners” have experience and expertise in a variety of roles including online teaching, online instructional design, administration or support of high quality online education, faculty support, student services, and related online initiatives, courses, and programs.
8c86c073-ff3f-4c93-91d1-a82f29d2727e.name: SUNY Online Teaching Fellow: Experienced Online Practitioner

a9b671e2-4440-46ab-9c82-be8898514013.description: Those verified into the “Expert Online Instructional Designer (ID)” role are experienced online IDs with significant expertise supporting online faculty in the design, development, and continuous improvements of effective online teaching and learning environments. Earners are recognized for sharing their expertise and volunteer activities. Earners of this badge represent members in our online community of practice whose participation, experience, and expertise come from within the SUNY system.

c994befd-c0c5-478a-b575-2a6e91cc3eb3.description: This acknowledges members in the SUNY Online Teaching community of practice whose participation, experience, and expertise come from within the SUNY system. Earners acknowledged as “Interested in Online Education” may include anyone from a any role who is interested in learning more about online teaching and learning, and willing to participate in the online community of practice.

8d48c879-78a4-4c76-bf3e-fe0b6d547e00.description: Those verified into the “Innovator/Researcher” role are recognized, published, and prize-winning online education scholars and innovators. Earners affirm that our SUNY Online Teaching community is enriched by those who study & report on what it means to teach and learn well online, as well as by those who innovate to improve online teaching and learning. Earners represent members in our online community of practice whose participation, experience, and expertise come from within the SUNY system.

4a66ab5c-7f56-45a0-8467-7faef0c4e3cf.description: This verifies that the earner selected successfully completed an internship with the SUNY Online Teaching unit. They experienced various aspects of supporting online teaching and learning to gain real-world experience in our award-winning online teaching and learning program. They have developed entry-level skills based on their interests in areas such as online instructional design and technology, online course quality, online faculty support/development, and related media/communications.
4a66ab5c-7f56-45a0-8467-7faef0c4e3cf.name: SUNY Online Teaching Intern

cbb6d818-7d59-42a5-861c-55f3c16c198e.description: This certifies that the earner has satisfactorily completed the four modules that comprise the SUNY Online “New to Online Learning” (N2OL) certificate program resulting in the design of an online course and preparation for online instruction & course management. They can present online content in an engaging manner; promote/facilitate online interaction & collaboration; and provide online feedback & assessments in effective/efficient manners. Earners have the fundamentals to teach online.
cbb6d818-7d59-42a5-861c-55f3c16c198e.name: SUNY Online Teaching: New to Online (N2OL) Certificate Program
